titleStmt.title: John L. Scott to James F. Robinson
CWG8558

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
JOHN L. SCOTT,
Attorney at Law,
FRANKFORT, KY.
OFFICE ADJOINING THE "YEOMAN" OFFICE.
REFERENCES:
Gov. Magoffin, Frankfort, Kentucky.
Judge Frazier, " "
Elder W. T. Moore, " "
Judge Duvall, Georgetown, Kentucky.
Hon. Wm. E. Simms, Paris, Kentucky.
Hon. John C. Mason, Owingsville, Ky
President Milligan, Bacon College, Ky.
Dr. Hopson, Lexington, Kentucky.
Judge Whitaker, Maysville, Ky.
I have the honor to submit to your consideration some additional papers in regard to the pardon of Kramer.

It appears that the protest of the Chief of Police was not written by that officer at all, but by a young man in his office. This protest is withdrawn in writing. I hope therefore that the old man will receive your pardon.
